Brooklyn Collection
Brooklyn Central YMCA Gymnastics Team collection
Between the Covers Rare Books
Brooklyn and Queens Young Men's Christian Association. Central Branch
Brooklyn Young Men's Christian Association. Central Branch
BCMS.0092
0.21 Linear Feet in one half manuscript box.
1933-1956 This collection includes photographs of the Brooklyn Central YMCA Gymnastics team in the 1930s, as well as a program from the 25th anniversary Silver Jubilee celebration in 1956 and a typewritten history of the first 25 years of the team. The majority of the materials in this collection are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact cbhreference@bklynlibrary.org at least two weeks prior to research visit.
Scope and Contents
This collection includes mostly photographs of the Brooklyn Central YMCA Gymnastics Team from 1933 to 1939. The photographs are group portraits taken by The Fifth Avenue Photo Studio Inc. showing the team in different costumes and poses. Also included in the collection are a program from the 25th anniversary Silver Jubilee celebration in 1956 and a typewritten history of the first 25 years of the team written by former member Norman E. Hecht.
Related Materials
Center for Brooklyn History holds the following related collections:
- Brooklyn YMCA Central Branch publications, 1884-1967 (ARC.169)
- Louise Hasbrook Brooklyn Navy YMCA collection, 1925-1986 (ARC.042)
The University of Minnesota Libraries' Department of Archives and Special Collections holds the Brooklyn Central YMCA records, 1854-1999 (Y.GNY.24) in the Kautz Family YMCA Archives.
Arrangement
This collection is arranged chronologically.
Historical Note
The Brooklyn Central YMCA Gymnastics Team was formed in 1931 by René Jules Kern. Kern was Assistant Director of Physical Education at the Brooklyn Central YMCA when he formed the gymnastics team and later became Director of Physical Education. The first team was made up of 12 men; women were admitted to the team in 1933.
The Team performed at the 1940 New York World's Fair, Madison Square Garden, colleges, schools, military bases, hospitals, and prisons.
Conditions Governing Access
Open to users without restriction.
Conditions Governing Use
While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Purchased from Between the Covers Rare Books, 2019.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date (if known); Brooklyn Central YMCA Gymnastics Team collection, BCMS.0092, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.
Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
The majority of the materials in this collection are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact cbhreference@bklynlibrary.org at least two weeks prior to research visit.
